data.title: Line breakpoints verified to column breakpoints are still treated as line breakpoints on next launch
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.13.1

I'm implementing a debug adapter for ocaml language. I found that vs code doesn't remember if a line breakpoint has been verified to a column breakpoint on next launch.

I record a gif to represent it.

![6 -28-2017 11-32-57](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/540298/27619519-98991fc4-5bf5-11e7-9768-39c9d5b8e802.gif)

This is desired:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/540298/27619539-bf63949a-5bf5-11e7-9553-eaf787243995.png)

data.title: Agile Community Enthusiast management
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->
Will vscode adopt the usage of github's ['Projects'](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/projects) feature to better manage community enthusiasts?

I saw this being used in another community [project](https://github.com/akeneo/pim-community-dev/projects/1) and I figured it was revolutionary. [This](https://github.com/moby/moby/projects/6) is another example albeit a little less impressive looking.

I see value in this feature when contrasted against the help wanted label [view](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/labels/help%20wanted)

data.title: Filter settings from no search results link
data.body:
This is an issue to cover PR #29261

> The user is encouraged to check the exclude settings when there are no search
results. Previously this would just open up the settings without any indication
which settings are relevant. This change will update the search filter to show
`files.exclude` and `search.exclude`.

data.title: Selecting a deleted line in the Diff Review Panel doesn't go to original editor

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
re https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/29496

* Open a changed file from Git Viewlet
* F7 to go to the Diff Review
* Use arrows to move down the selection, move to a deleted
* Press enter, it always selects the last line before the deleted area in the modified editor.

data.title: Triple click + drag doesnt copy the selection
data.body:
Testing #29483 on Windows

- Triple click a line, right click on prompt: paste is succsesful
- Triple click a line and drag to another line so now you have 2 lines in the selection, right click on prompt: the previous selection is pasted

data.title: No source map when debugging unit tests
data.body:
Testing #29476

- OS Version: Linux -> ubuntu 16.04

Steps to Reproduce:
Follow ["Chrome Debugging with Angular CLI"](https://github.com/weinand/vscode-recipes/tree/master/Angular-CLI) debugging unit tests.

The app tests run fine, but the unit tests don't seem to have source maps attached. Thus, the breakpoints don't work.

data.title: An additional empty is restored when launching window from command line

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
re https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/29249

* Set `window.reopenWindows ` to `all`
* Launch VS Code from Spotlight/Alfred
* An empty window is launched.
* Open a folder from command line, a window with target folder is opened
* Quit VSCode
* Launch VS Code again, now three windows launch, two empty windows and a window with folder.

data.title: Window always restored in primary monitor

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
re https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/29249

I don't think it's Code issue but still log this to see if we can do anything to mitigate it:

* Have two monitors
* Open VSCode, it shows up in primary monitor
* Move the window to secondary monitor
* Quit
* Launch VS Code again. It shows up in primary monitor again

Feel free to close it if it doesn't make any sense.

data.title: Auto indent: Ruby multi-line string looses indentation level

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.14.0-insider (c854b698d2af794a0a3c6645133b48b776e58a28, 2017-06-27T09:29:47.979Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0
- Extensions: none
---

Test #29493

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Move the `return` line up and down:
```
def auth
    unless un && pw
        stderr.puts <<~EOF
            Hello...
        EOF
    end
    
    return 'foo'
end
```
2. The 'Hello...' line looses one indentation level:
![jun-27-2017 14-32-25](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9205389/27611058-9c6c02f2-5b45-11e7-8a0e-b2227f716f58.gif)

Also: When I enter the multi-line string it would be nice if `<<~` would trigger an additional indentation level on the next line. Maybe that doesn't fit with the rules engine.

data.title: Allow extensions to update folder based configuration
data.body:
testing  #29466:

- this 3 folder setup:
  ![2017-06-27_22-40-31](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1898161/27608991-a84497b2-5b89-11e7-895c-7e8c2390a1d2.png)
- value for "editor.lineNumbers" in the 3 setting files:
  - main: "relative"
  - f1: "on"
  - f2: "off"
- this code in "sayHello" handler of "hello world" extension:
  ```ts
        const uri = vscode.window.activeTextEditor.document.uri;
        const config = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration2("editor", uri);
        config.update("lineNumbers", "on");
  ```
- open f2.txt in editor (which lives in folder f2 and has the editor.lineNumbers value "off")
- trigger sayHello command

Observe:
"editor.lineNumbers" in f2's settings file does not change.

data.title: Symbol search hangs VSCode
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.13.1
- OS Version: Arch Linux, Kernel: 4.11.6-3

I am using VSCode on a huge PHP project. I am using felixfbecker/vscode-php-intellisense to index the codebase. Autocomplete, jump to definition, ... all work. 

When I want to use symbol search panel interface freezes and CPU usage goes through the roof. Interface stays completely unresponsive for minutes. I confirmed that it is VSCode process that is doing this. 

Any thoughts?

I already reported this in felixfbecker/vscode-php-intellisense#130 and they sent me here.

  ```ts
        const config = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration2("editor", uri);
        const info = config.inspect("lineNumbers");
  ```
- open f2.txt in editor (which lives in folder f2 and has the editor.lineNumbers value "off")
- trigger sayHello command

Observe:
The lineNumbers value in config is "off" (which is the expected value):
![2017-06-27_22-45-44](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1898161/27609199-66b08666-5b8a-11e7-8598-fb4e91a3a55d.png)

The "folderValue" in info is undefined. This is unexpected because the value "off" comes from a folder:
![2017-06-27_22-44-09](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1898161/27609131-2713dd78-5b8a-11e7-8f1c-c4eba9245034.png)

data.title: Integrated Terminal scroll bar hidden when focus in Find widget

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.14 Insiders
- OS Version: Windows 7

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Generate several pages in the Integrated Terminal so that the scroll bar appears.
2. Do a search with several matches.
3. Place mouse over Find Widget or use the Previous and Next buttons

The terminal scroll bar fades away.

This makes it hard to see the current match location relative to the terminal output pages.

Once focus in back in the terminal, the scroll bar fades back visible.

data.title: AutoIndent not consistent when moving lines in JSON
data.body:
Testing #29493

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1487073/27607613-47d6e9de-5b39-11e7-9e94-ddb668320f99.png)

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  open settings file (`cmd+,`).  mine has many settings, for example:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1487073/27607700-9d725284-5b39-11e7-8ae1-e2270202c80d.png)

2. In the above example, put the cursor on `"editor.renderWhitespace": "boundary",` (line 13)
3. Move the line down to the `"[markdown]": {` section

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1487073/27607760-db392390-5b39-11e7-9a89-302c84513fea.png)

Result: the `"editor.renderWhitespace": "boundary",` line is in properly indented.  This is goodness.

4. Now, move the line back up, outside of the `"[markdown]": {` section:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1487073/27607824-164864a0-5b3a-11e7-9be4-84e69673d210.png)

Result: the line is not outdented as expected.
